description:
Dryas iulia moderata, commonly known as the Pale Heliconian or Moderately Variable Heliconian, is a subspecies of butterfly belonging to the family Nymphalidae. It is found in parts of Central and South America, including Mexico, Guatemala, and Honduras.

The Pale Heliconian is a medium-sized butterfly with a wingspan of approximately 7-9 centimeters. The upper side of the wings is predominantly pale yellow or white, with dark brown or black patterns along the edges and veins. The underside of the wings is typically more muted in color, often with a grayish or brownish hue.

This subspecies is known for its moderate variability in wing pattern and coloration, with some individuals exhibiting more pronounced dark markings or a slightly different shade of yellow or white. The degree of variation can be influenced by factors such as geography, environmental conditions, and individual genetic differences.

Dryas iulia moderata is considered a member of the heliconian group, which is known for its diverse and striking wing patterns. These butterflies play important ecological roles, often serving as pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of their habitats.
